p: To contribute to the increasing demand for plant-based products as natural remedies, this study seeks to assess the cytotoxic, antimalarial, and trypanocidal potency of M. pruriens used in folk medicine and then evaluate the phytochemicals and antioxidant activities of the plant. It is our informed opinion that the outcome of this research will assist pharmaceutical industries and households that may want to explore the plant as a food supplement or for medicinal purposes.
